definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
obstinately clinging to one's course (idiom)/willful/one's own way/dogmatic
to stake all on one throw
lit. lone army putting up a brave fight (idiom)/fig. (of a person or group of people) struggling hard without support
solitary old man or woman/regular patron (at brothels)
one who is cut off from others (idiom)/one who has chosen to follow a solitary path/(can also be an indirect way of referring to an unmarried person)

sentences.english: Late at night she walked alone in the street, appearing even more lonely and solitary.
sentences.chinese: 深夜，她一个人走在街头，越发显得身单影孤。

sentences.english: May the slightest residue of white, ape calls out alone.
sentences.chinese: 梅残半点白，猿叫一声孤。

sentences.english: I should not have to live my eternity away from my little spider .
sentences.chinese: 我不会离开我的小蜘蛛而孤凄地度过那无边岁月的。

sentences.english: But Amy appear some solitary zero point zero a person.
sentences.chinese: 唯独艾米显得有些孤零点零的一个人。

sentences.english: In order to study parthenogenesis in depth, ES cells from parthenogenetic embryos of mice were isolated and cultured.
sentences.chinese: 对小鼠卵母细胞进行孤雌激活用于单性生殖研究。

sentences.english: This is the end of the Shangcai county cadres AIDS by helping and supporting students in a solitary lens.
sentences.chinese: 这是上蔡县干部结对帮扶艾滋病致孤学生的一个镜头。

sentences.english: Look at my word not solitary WuTu "work".
sentences.chinese: 请看吾道不孤处女作《巫途》。

sentences.english: West Court disease widow, nephew after bed alone.
sentences.chinese: 西院病孀妇，后床孤侄儿。

sentences.english: School-age children orphaned by AIDS receive free compulsory education.
sentences.chinese: 艾滋病致孤学龄儿童接受免费义务教育。

sentences.english: Are There Dangling Topics in Mandarin Chinese?
Electric activation of porcine oocytes was explored in this study.
sentences.chinese: 研究了电激活参数对猪卵母细胞孤雌发育的影响。

sentences.english: Life is a mystery, everyone must stand, alone.
sentences.chinese: 生命神秘，每个人都孤沉地站着。

sentences.english: Lining at night accompanying in lonly street lamp.
sentences.chinese: 甾孤単街灯陪伴硪的夜晚里。

sentences.english: She paid the fee to the lone wolf wolf eyeliner, but pushes away.
sentences.chinese: 她付眼线费给孤狼，孤狼却推拒了。

definition: I (first person pronoun used by royalty or nobility)
high ranking official (old)/term of endearment between spouses (old)/(from the Tang Dynasty onwards) term used by the emperor for his subjects (old)/honorific (old)
old variant of 愷|恺[kai3]/old variant of 凱|凯[kai3]
courtier's or minister's form of address for the current Emperor
I, me (self-referring by a widowed empress etc, used in historical novels and operas)
